page.title: 18LANDSCAPE.
page.content: { The Knavesmire}is a big place.It is called that because the Knaves were hanged there,and mire means boggy.York Races are held there.The first race meeting was held in 1731.There are a lot of football pitches on the Knavesmire.People play cricket there,and take their dogs for walks. { Holgate Windmill,}in Acomb,was built between 1770 and 1825.There has been a windmill on the site since 1360.It still retains its cogs,pulley and millstone. In{St.Paul's Square}the houses are terraced.There is a Nursery School.In the middle of the square is some grass and some logs to climb on. { Acomb Green}is a play area with slides,swings and climbing frames.There is a war memorial to remember the two World Wars and the death of a local man in the Falklands.
